{{cpp/ranges/title|greater}}
{{cpp/utility/functional/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl header|functional}}
{{dcl|since=c++20|
struct greater;
}}
{{dcl end}}

Function object for performing comparisons. Deduces the parameter types of the function call operator from the arguments (but not the return type).

===Nested types===
{{dsc begin}}
{{dsc hitem|Nested type|Definition}}
{{dsc|{{tt|is_transparent}}|[[cpp/utility/functional#Transparent function objects|unspecified]]}}
{{dsc end}}

===Member functions===
{{dsc begin}}
{{dsc mem fun|operator()|nolink=true|checks if the first argument is ''greater'' than the second}}
{{dsc end}}

{{member|1={{small|std::ranges::greater::}}operator()|2=
{{ddcl|
template&lt; class T, class U &gt;
constexpr bool operator()( T&amp;&amp; t, U&amp;&amp; u ) const;
}}

Equivalent to {{c|return ranges::less{}(std::forward&lt;U&gt;(u), std::forward&lt;T&gt;(t));}}.

{{cpp/enable if|{{c|std::totally_ordered_with&lt;T, U&gt;}} is satisfied}}.
}}

===Notes===
Unlike {{lc|std::greater}}, {{tt|std::ranges::greater}} requires all six comparison operators {{tt|&lt;}}, {{tt|1=&lt;=}}, {{tt|&gt;}}, {{tt|1=&gt;=}}, {{tt|1===}} and {{tt|1=!=}} to be valid (via the  {{lconcept|totally_ordered_with}} constraint) and is entirely defined in terms of 
{{lc|std::ranges::less}}.
